Module SnakeAndLadder
Package harmony.mavenproject1

Class App

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
harmony.mavenproject1.App
public class App extends javafx.application.Application
Huynh Minh 40210039 comp249 assignment 1 due feb 7 2022 I spent some time researching the graphical part of the game and found the javafx library. This game is thus coded in javafx and not java. Because I havent truly learnt javafx, I went very conservatively with my coding, in lots of places I used copy paste on the same bit of code instead of using methods and proper object oriented programming, this will become clear later on. This also means some things I could do in java i did not find a wway to replicate in javafx. For instance I cannot tamper with packages or rename my class to SnakeAndLadder. I also tried moving the main method to another file and renaming it PlaySnakeAndLadder but the program wouldnt run. From what I can observe, javafx has extensive dependencies I can't yet tamper with. I'm not 100% positive this will run outside my IDE. Needless to say all the javafx stuff is heavily sampled from online tutorials
Author:
40210039

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    changebuttontext()
    This function changes the text on the player buttons so we know whose turn it is
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    it seems that for javafx you cant really touch the main method I didnt need to as this was pre generated by my IDE
    void
    setNumplayers()
    asks how many players to create, fairly straightforward I used a while loop to check for invalid entries Since we barely started exception handling I will assume that the users are perfect and only enter ints.
    void
    start(javafx.stage.Stage Board)
    I coded the game to start in console, honestly it would have been possible to make everything run in the game board but it would have been adding even more complication to a program I don't fully understand Basically it will first ask how many players to create, once that's done, the game board will appear and we can start playing.

      I coded the game to start in console, honestly it would have been possible to make everything run in the game board but it would have been adding even more complication to a program I don't fully understand Basically it will first ask how many players to create, once that's done, the game board will appear and we can start playing.
